intro: Galatella pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered galatella, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Galatella pauciflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
